messages: 9ccb999806cc0e065a5d80dfb0f0d3eb (05:37): anyone know how far [roughly] a 700mw transmitter would go in a hilly / wooded area?
a20c00215ff91bf327808fcf6d1b00bc (05:38): at what frequency?
a20c00215ff91bf327808fcf6d1b00bc (05:38): at what height?
9ccb999806cc0e065a5d80dfb0f0d3eb (05:39): at what elevation is the site, or at what elevation is the antenna?
f885ff222384af76169c91feb69fd288 (05:39): you tell us
a20c00215ff91bf327808fcf6d1b00bc (05:39): 2.4, no matter what power, has a really hard time penetrating trees
a20c00215ff91bf327808fcf6d1b00bc (05:39): and will *not* penetrate dirt.
a20c00215ff91bf327808fcf6d1b00bc (05:40): if you can't realistically see whatever you're trying to hit, you can pretty much forget 2.4 or any other microwave frequency working for you.
9ccb999806cc0e065a5d80dfb0f0d3eb (05:40): so what's the next best thing?
f885ff222384af76169c91feb69fd288 (05:41): though it doesn't push dirt either
a20c00215ff91bf327808fcf6d1b00bc (05:41): yeah, and foliage does 'hurt' it, just not as much.
9ccb999806cc0e065a5d80dfb0f0d3eb (05:41): i basically have to go about 1000 feet...  site a is about 300 ft below site b
a20c00215ff91bf327808fcf6d1b00bc (05:41): how thick is the foliage in between?
f885ff222384af76169c91feb69fd288 (05:41): why don't you just try the 2.4GHz radios then?
a20c00215ff91bf327808fcf6d1b00bc (05:42): 2.4 ghz radios + good directional antennas pointed properly = teh win
9ccb999806cc0e065a5d80dfb0f0d3eb (05:42): it's mostly oak and manzanita, but pretty thick..
a20c00215ff91bf327808fcf6d1b00bc (05:42): if that doesn't work... I'd say get some SR9's and some SBCs that can properly handle them.
9ccb999806cc0e065a5d80dfb0f0d3eb (05:42): so doesn't require line of sight when it's that close?
a20c00215ff91bf327808fcf6d1b00bc (05:42): you can penetrate *some* foliage
a20c00215ff91bf327808fcf6d1b00bc (05:42): theres a big difference between say, 10 miles, and 1000 ft.
f885ff222384af76169c91feb69fd288 (05:42): the trees will attenuate the signal
f885ff222384af76169c91feb69fd288 (05:43): not completely block it
a20c00215ff91bf327808fcf6d1b00bc (05:43): attenuate with absorbtion and multipath
f885ff222384af76169c91feb69fd288 (05:43): as long as you have enough reaching the receiver you should be ok
9ccb999806cc0e065a5d80dfb0f0d3eb (05:44): next question, where do i get this stuff?  it's obviously not stuff you get at best buy
f885ff222384af76169c91feb69fd288 (05:44): many places
a20c00215ff91bf327808fcf6d1b00bc (05:44): for simple stuff like this I suggest linksys wrt54gl's, openwrt or dd-wrt, and good antennas.
f885ff222384af76169c91feb69fd288 (05:44): i get a lot of stuff from bizsyscon.com
f885ff222384af76169c91feb69fd288 (05:45): they have a good deal on the SR9 right now too
9ccb999806cc0e065a5d80dfb0f0d3eb (05:46): huh...  does the sr9 work with WRAP?
a20c00215ff91bf327808fcf6d1b00bc (05:46): geekfound: yes, but you'll need an OS that does 5 or 10 mhz channels.  SR9 on 20 mhz sucks.
a20c00215ff91bf327808fcf6d1b00bc (05:47): Routerboard 112s are a better deal anyways.
a20c00215ff91bf327808fcf6d1b00bc (05:47): wtf is that?
f885ff222384af76169c91feb69fd288 (05:48): a routerboard
f885ff222384af76169c91feb69fd288 (05:48): though it's not on mikrotik's site
a20c00215ff91bf327808fcf6d1b00bc (05:48): weird
f885ff222384af76169c91feb69fd288 (05:48): has 3 mini-pcis
a20c00215ff91bf327808fcf6d1b00bc (05:48): what is it?
9ccb999806cc0e065a5d80dfb0f0d3eb (05:48): what os do you use with the RB-112?
a20c00215ff91bf327808fcf6d1b00bc (05:48): geekfound: comes with mt routeros installed.
f885ff222384af76169c91feb69fd288 (05:49): http://www.wisp-router.com/itemdesc.asp?ic=RB153&eq=&Tp=
9ccb999806cc0e065a5d80dfb0f0d3eb (05:49): wow, sweet.
9ccb999806cc0e065a5d80dfb0f0d3eb (05:51): to use an external antenna with the sr9 do you have to solder a dongle / connector to the board?
f885ff222384af76169c91feb69fd288 (05:51): just buy a pig tail
f885ff222384af76169c91feb69fd288 (05:51): takes the u.fl on it to a N
9ccb999806cc0e065a5d80dfb0f0d3eb (05:51): sweet!
9ccb999806cc0e065a5d80dfb0f0d3eb (05:54): thanks for imparting some wisdom, definitely enough to get me into trouble
